double_crochet at the end of the row turn row 4-through endpoint repeat row 3 until you reach a length of 30 inches for a cowl or 60 inches or more for an infinity scarf you can try it on to find your perfect endpoint break the yarn leaving a 15 inch tail and pull the yarn through the last st this tail will be used for the final seam i recommend a light spritz wet block before sewing the final seam so that the width is the same across the scarf light spritz wet blocking optional pin the scarf out on blocking mats or a bed covered with a towel pin it so that it s the same width across for the length of the scarf and the edges are straight it s not necessary to aggressively block or stretch to add any length you will need to lightly stretch it out to 9 inches wide or the width you prefer lightly spritz with water from a spray bottle and let dry turn it over and pin it down the same way and spritz lightly and let dry final seam the final flat piece you have crocheted is reversible both sides are the same you will bring the ends together so that they match up corner to corner thread the long yarn tail into a darning needle and you may need to stitch backward to the corner point then run the needle through one top loop on one side and the corresponding top loop on the other side do not pull
